intro: Erigeron setiferus, commonly known as the woolly fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the United States, particularly in the western regions. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils, and it is known for its soft, woolly foliage. Erigeron setiferus produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its adaptability to arid conditions makes it an important species in ecological restoration projects.
